content.description: This is a one move wonder dynamic move off the c-shaped flake to the top.
content.location: It is on the far right side on the back of Sto Away.

content.description: Okay, so there are two ways to go about this arete problem, but they both stand start on a small, sloped ledge on the right by the tree. From here, you can either use the features on the broken arete for left hand holds and move up the slab face or traverse left to use the edge of the arete and stand on the broken, sloped arete. Either way, they are both fun challenges for climbers looking to work on a balancy route.
content.location: Follow description for Sto Away Boulder. Move around the backside, and you will see the obvious, sloped arete to the left of the tree.

content.description:
These routes are off the beaten path but are worth a look when you're on your way in or out of the Weetamoo area. So being you won't see a soul, you will have no worries about being in the way of bikers. 

  Also, try and check out the rock to the NW. There might be more to offer.
